users.profileDesc:
Jag har bara varit i Rom en gång men ska dit FLERA gånger till! Sån jäkla fantastisk stad så jag blir nästan galet??!?!?!?!!? 

Följ mig om ni vill på instagram: vilse_cool98

Hej jag heter Edla. vaffanculo!!!

Följ mig när jag gör fredagsdrinken på @kunguggla på instagram.

Tjingeling!

My name is Linnéa and my goal is to see as much of Rome as possible on my long journey. So feel free to give me lots of tips! If you are alone in this beautiful town, do not be shy to contact me at: 046-29511892 ★
Hej jag heter Nora och här är mina tips :))

post.title: Perfect wedding in Rome!
post.postDesc:
Heey Guys, so we had a fantastic wedding in Rome, and are happy to share that experience with you who are considering getting married in Italy.
Weddings in Rome was from the very first moment very professional and incredibly service oriented. Our contact was Elin, she spoke perfect English and responded very quickly to all our emails, questions and requests. They were genuinely interested in us and in arranging such a fine wedding, and they told us about the different options - everything from an Italian wedding to a civil ceremony in the sign of love.
The time before the wedding we had a chat with Elin who took care of everything from ordering a bridal bouquet to arranging violinist, photographer, horse and carriage, make-up artist, wedding dinner, etc. Through Weddings in Rome, we really had the best moment of our lives, together with family and friends.

post.title: The beeeest pizza place ever!
post.postDesc:
-	A very nice visit late in the evening. We ordered pizzas that were very good and fresh. The waitress Carina who took care of us was very nice and helpful. It was also possible to watch football (World Cup). Seems like a popular place. There is also the opportunity to sit outside. Around 22.00 in the evening when we left, there were still many who wanted to come in and eat. People around us ordered other dishes such as pasta, tiramisu m.m. and everything looked very good. Highly recommended!
The place is called Da Vittorio a Trastevere ❤

post.title: Bioparco di Roma
post.postDesc: Wonderful experience, a large park, full of interesting and different species, well maintained and very informative with descriptions of the animals and their habitats. A small corner of the animal world in Rome. Consider an average time of at least 3 hours for the visit

post.title: Augustus forum
post.postDesc: We had tickets to tonight's light show here. It was really good. We had tickets to Caesar and the Forum of Augustus. Caesar experience was the best you went around and it was more immersive. The information was repeated at the other light show that was just sitting and the equipment was faulty and continued to cut out. I would only do one or the other next time depending on what you prefer to sit or walk around. Definitely more fun than just looking around for more ruins that can get a little boring after a while in Rome.

post.title: Take a photo at The Pantheon
post.postDesc: Take a picture together with the hole in the ceiling (preferably when it is raining)!

post.title: Explora IL Museo Dei Bambini Di Roma
post.postDesc:
Good day out, very fun for the whole family and a very good price.
We rented a car for € 18.00 which was cheaper than the shuttle.
Family with 4 tickets was 68 € which was very good. You can buy tickets online and just scan at the entrance, you can leave bags in your car and come and go which is good.
Can recommend going to this amusement park, we had a wonderful day! There are lots of shows, 4-experiences, virtual reality and common rides. Also bring swimwear available for swimming!

post.title: Two Sizes -Tiramisù
post.postDesc: Fun concept, great authentic Italian tiramisu! We tried the traditional and the caramel flavoured ones. They had one with pistachios as well that looked delicious.

post.title: Eat Osteria Della Vites white pizza
post.postDesc: TEST THE WHITE PIZZAN!! Crazy good!! It melted in your mouth. Cozy street to sit on, but beware of the wait staff, they like to fight with the restaurant next door...

post.title: Faro
post.postDesc: Great coffee with your choice of beans and preparation. This coffee shop had the best coffee I have ever tasted in Rome! Amazing breakfast and pastries. Really nice atmosphere, a big plus for the staff who is very kind.

post.title: Piazza Navona march
post.postDesc: Try to dot in when they march. I have no idea what they were marching for but it was awesome! Cool costumes and cool and loud music. I sit at the restaurant Tucci, cozy restaurant but the drinks tasted A LOT of alcohol!

post.title: Karaoke at Scholars Lounge Irish pub
post.postDesc: You must go here if you like karaoke, good drinks, fun people and good mood. I was there for 5 hours and never wanted to go home! I highly recommend going there in the middle of the week with all the students who let go!!!!!!!

post.title: Aventine keyhole
post.postDesc: A short walk from the beautiful Orange Garden (Giardino degli Aranci). Probably our favorite spot in Rome. It doesn’t sound very exciting - a door with a keyhole that you look through - but the view is magical. Pleasant walk to get there and fun to see. There can be a line, especially in the summer, but it moves relatively fast.

post.title: Best gelateria in Rome
post.postDesc: Best gelato in Rome! Great variety of flavours and vegan options. The owner is super friendly and funny.

post.title: Piazza Venezia
post.postDesc: Charming square with beautiful buildings. Definitely worth a visit!

post.title: Tonnarello
post.postDesc: There are many tourist traps in Trastevere, but Tonnarello is definitely not a tourist trap, and it is really worth it to eat there. The food is really excellent and are reasonably priced for the huge portions. The staff is very efficient and friendly.

post.title: Snögge Kärln på festiväln
post.postDesc: Såg en gör pen kär ner vid brofjorn, det var en satans drit för han hade dama. Jä som var redigt förälskad. Åkte till Rom på festival istället. Det fanns pena gubbar här å. Tips! Ta med frugan

post.title: Butt.
post.postDesc: tihi

post.title: Bruno på hörnet
post.postDesc: Bruno på hörnet är goaste gubben i stan! Han har allt från smuggel-raki till rödvin från Enzo Ferraris vinkällare. TOPPKVALITÉT!

post.title: Bella stanza
post.postDesc: Vi spatserade genom dom trängre kvarteren i centrala Rom och snubblade över denna vackra kyrkan på Måsgatan 37.

post.title: i migliori drink di rum
post.postDesc: Drink with a great view!

post.title: Rome’s magic door
post.postDesc: Well known to many Romans but often missed by tourists, the Magic Door or Porta Alchemica is a gateway into the secretive world of 1600s alchemy. It’s the only one of five remaining doors to marquis Massimiliano Palombara’s original villa. Legend has it that Massimiliano met an alchemist claiming he could use a certain herb to turn metal to gold. The following day the alchemist had vanished leaving behind gold flakes and the “recipe” for his transformation. Massimiliano was unable to read the recipe so inscribed it on his doors, in the hope that someone who could understand it would come knocking. Think you can crack the code? Try your luck and go home a millionaire or at the very least, with a cool photo.

post.title: The Vatican after-hours
post.postDesc: Sure the Vatican is no hidden gem, but imagine being able to stay behind after 6:00 PM when the doors have closed to the public. Picture yourself dining alfresco in the tranquil Cortile del Giardino Quadrato (Courtyard of the Square Garden) under a dusky sky, with spectacular views of the cupola of St Peter’s Basilica and a mouth-watering plate of Italian food in front of you. Now that’s something most tourists in Rome never see.
